pub_created_display: Ann of Great Britain (1702 to 1707), London
notes_display: Medal commemorates the union of England and Scotland.  This medal is one of two similar medals in which only the shoulder straps differ.  This type has a plain shoulder strap, whereas the other type has a decorated shoulder strap.
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: Anne with hair up and crown on top of head.  Ornamented dress with plain shoulder straps.
issue_obverse_legend_s: ANNA . D : G . MAG : BRI : FR : ET . HIB : REG :
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: Arms of England and Scotland are shown impaled to commemorate the union of England and Scotland.  Two new coats of arms are depicted; one being a conjunction of the crosses of St. George and St. Andrew, the other a rose and thistle growing upon one stalk.
